name: Viva La Vino Wine Festival: Bangalore Edition
description: Viva La Vino – Bangalore EditionGet ready, Bangalore – after a smashing debut last year, India's coolest wine festival is back in your city with a bigger, bolder and even more fun Season 2! Co-curated by Sommeliers Gargi Kothari and Devati Mallick, VLV is the first-of-its-kind, a super-fun, laid-back festival with great wines + vibes, while building a wine culture that’s playful, welcoming, and totally unforgettable. Experience an evening of tasting wines with old and new wine friends in a full-on festival setting. Trust us, we will have you falling in love with the wine life all over again!What's in store this year:90+ wines from around the world: Sip, swirl, and savour a stunning lineup of international and Indian wines at your own pace. Discover new favourites, revisit classics, or surprise yourself with something unexpected. All wine tastings are included in your festival ticket.Artisan cheese: Your ticket includes a dreamy artisan cheese cup for one, so you can sip and snack at the same time. Want more? Shop extra platters and also take home your cheesy favourites.Craft chocolate: Meet India’s finest craft chocolate producers and shop their gourmet range to sweeten your evening. Wine, cheese, and chocolate are always a good idea!Taste + buy: Loved a wine? Don’t just dream about it—take it home that very night with special festival-only bottle prices.Exclusive masterclass: Get a masterclass ticket for a guided tasting of 4 premium wines not available at the main fest. A rare chance to dive deep with a cool sommelier, 25 seats only!Groovy music + poolside vibes: VLV Bangalore takes over the stunning poolside at JW Marriott Bengaluru. Their resident DJ will be spinning a banging set to keep the vibes flowing all evening.Live food stations: Indulge in mouthwatering bites from live stations curated by JW’s chefs, available to purchase on-site.Last year was a hot sell-out, and this year promises to be even bigger. Bring a friend, your partner, a whole gang of wine buddies, or come solo and find your tribe here. Just don’t miss it. See you there?

location.address: 24/1, Vittal Mallya Rd, KG Halli, Shanthala Nagar, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001, India

organizer.name: Viva La Vino
organizer.description: Welcome to VLV – the ultimate wine festival! Co-curated by Sommeliers Gargi Kothari (Magic Cellars) and Devati Mallick (Drink With D), VLV travels across 8 cities in its season 2 this year, celebrating wine, culture, and community. Join us for the best wines, fun vibes, and unforgettable memories..

name: Whose Mic Is It Anyways?  Two Shots & One Open Mic
description: Whose Mic Is It Anyway?: Open Mic NightsIt’s yours!An open mic event welcoming all musicians, comedians, poets, storytellers, and more. Whether you’re a first-timer or a seasoned performer, this open mic is for you.It will be a safe space (rather, a safe stage) for you to try out your new stand-up material, to perform a poem close to your heart, or sing that song you’re not confident about. No pressure, no judgement; just a place for you to own the spotlight and give the world your best.And for our audience: come and enjoy a fun evening with some of the cities most talented artists. (See performers? We’re already cheering for you!)This event happens every alternate week, so if you can’t make it this time, you can sign up for it next time!About the host: OninthoughOften branded as a sarcastic soul and an outright cynic, Oninthough is infamous for his observational humour and satirical comedy, often coupled with political undertones and religious overtones.Oninthough was crowned "Lord of Humour" at UNMAAD 2021, IIM-Bangalore. His humour has been lauded by the likes of internationally acclaimed comedians like Craig Shoemaker, Matt Banwart, and Raj Poojara, and renowned Indian comedian Kunal Kamra. He has also been featured by DailyHunt, DNA, Times Now, Indian Express, Aaj Tak, WhatsHOT Bangalore, The Sarcastic Indian, and many other publications.He has performed for audiences across 20+ cities, 7 countries, and 3 continents. With over 75k shares across social media, his punchlines and humour jabs are amongst the most shared comedic content.

name: Dialogues with Books: Monthly Meetup
description: Join Bangalore`s Iconic Book Community - Monthly DWB Meetup! 📚Join Dialogues with Books (DWB) for our monthly gathering where fellow bibliophiles come together to celebrate the joy of reading!What We`ll Do -Come with a book you`ve been enjoying lately - any genre welcome! We`ll all share what we`re reading, why it resonates with us, and dive into lively discussions about the stories and ideas that captivate us. Feel free to read favourite passages aloud and discover your next great read through fellow bibliophiles` recommendations.Expect an evening of engaging book conversations over warm beverages, light snacks, and great company!About DWB - Dialogues with Books is one of Bangalore`s oldest book communities, creating a vibrant, inclusive space where literature lovers share their passion and form lasting friendships through books. Whether you`re a seasoned reader or looking to reconnect with reading, you`ll find a warm welcome here.DWB is Perfect For: Book enthusiasts, readers wanting to discover new genres, and anyone seeking thoughtful literary conversations in Bangalore`s vibrant reading community.Location: Dialogues KoramangalaMeet Your Host: Bharat - Bharat is an avid reader, writer, and passionate bibliophile with eclectic literary tastes spanning classics, fiction, philosophy, poetry, and self-improvement. His favorite authors include Hemingway, Murakami, Mishima, P.G. Wodehouse, and Edgar Allan Poe. His infectious enthusiasm for books and skill at facilitating discussions makes every meetup both stimulating and enjoyable.

name: The Bohra Thaal – An Authentic Bohra Cuisine
description: Have You Ever Experienced Dining in a Traditional Bohra Thaal?If not, here’s your chance to be part of an intimate and one-of-a-kind home dining experience. Hosted in the comfort of a warm, welcoming home, this gathering brings together like-minded individuals to share a meal, exchange stories, and turn strangers into friends—all while indulging in the rich flavors of Bohra cuisine.Bohra cuisine originates from the Bohra Muslim community, with roots tracing back to Yemen before flourishing in India. Over the centuries, it has evolved into a delightful fusion of Middle Eastern, Mughlai, Gujarati, and Maharashtrian flavors, reflecting a legacy of migration, trade, and cultural influences.What makes Bohra dining truly special is its communal style—meals are served in a giant "Thaal", where 4 to 6 guests dine together, fostering a deep sense of connection, warmth, and tradition.From Finance to Flavours: My Journey into Bohra CuisineAs a Chartered Accountant, I built a career in finance, working with esteemed firms like Avendus and ASK. While finance was my profession, my true passion lay in cooking.Back in Mumbai, my home-cooked meals were always a highlight among friends and colleagues. After relocating to Bengaluru six months ago, I finally decided to follow my culinary dream, giving birth to The Bohra Thaal—a heartfelt endeavor to bring the authentic Bohra "Thaal" experience to Namma Bengaluru.Now, we invite you to be part of this journey and savor a 9-course Bohra feast—served with love, straight from our home to your plate.What to Expect?🍽️ Indulge in an authentic 9-course Bohra feast🍛 Dine the traditional way—sharing a giant Thaal with 4 to 6 guests🏡 Experience the warmth of home-style communal dining⏳ Pre-booking closes 2 days in advance"The nourishment of the body is food, while the nourishment of the soul is feeding others." — Hazrat Ali

location.address: BLOCK-10, PRESTIGE NOTTING HILL, Bannerghatta Rd, Kalena Agrahara, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560076, India

organizer.name: TheBohraThaal
organizer.description: The Bohra Thaal offers a unique home dining experience, bringing the rich traditions of Bohra cuisine to your table. Dine the authentic way—sharing a giant Thaal, savoring a curated 9-course feast, and connecting over food in a warm, welcoming home. Come as strangers, leave as friends!

name: Mahabharata Dialogues - Epic Stories
description: Embark on a captivating journey into the legendary stories of the Mahabharata. Join us for a series of live storytelling sessions that will transport you into the fascinating world of the greatest epic ever written. Immerse yourself in that world and discover the heroic deeds, complex relationships, and moral dilemmas that have enthralled audiences for centuries.Host : Abhilash Purohit is an entrepreneur and a corporate educator.These last few years, he is stuck between two states of existence: (Re)reading the Mahabharata, and talking about the characters in it - their interactions, their aspirations, and their dilemmas.To audiences small and big, he brings the joy of the stories and the lessons within the Mahabharata. He finds and shares different perspectives of well-known stories from the world`s greatest epic.When not talking Mahabharata, he loves to geek out about coding and Urdu shayari.

name: Basic Pencil Sketching Workshop
description: Basic Pencil Sketching Workshop - This isn’t just about sketching — it’s about slowing down, focusing your mind, and surprising yourself with what you can create.If you can hold a pencil, you can start here.Why This Event? - Always wanted to sketch but didn’t know where to begin?This workshop is designed for people who think they "can’t draw" — no experience needed. You'll learn the fundamentals of pencil sketching in a supportive, beginner-friendly space, with step-by-step guidance throughout.Whether it’s your first time sketching or you’re just looking to restart an old hobby, this session will help you understand the basics — and walk away with your own finished portrait.Duration : 3 hours (180–190 minutes)Enough time to learn, practice, and complete your first portrait with support.All basic art supplies will be provided during the session: Pencil set, Sharpener, Eraser, Blending tools, 4 sheets of sketching paperJust bring yourself — we’ll take care of the rest.What You’ll Learn & Take Away:Basics of pencil shading & stroke controlScience behind smooth blendingTools & techniques to create contrast and highlightsOne complete basic pencil portrait (made by you)Confidence to continue sketching at homeWho Can Join : Absolute beginners - Anyone aged 12 to 75 years- No prior drawing experience neededAbout the Host : Bharani Elangovan is a self-taught artist with 9+ years of experience in pencil sketching and hyperrealistic art. With a calm and clear teaching style, Bharani focuses on helping beginners understand why each technique works — making sketching approachable and enjoyable for everyone.

name: CHIRPS & TRAILS by Green Panther Club
description: Join us on Chirpy Trails – a playful morning of bird-spotting, nature games, and discovering the hidden feathered friends of our city!What if the trees around you were alive with secret songs? On Chirpy Trails, kids and parents will step into nature’s living orchestra – spotting colorful birds, tuning into their calls, and learning fun ways to track them. Along the way, we’ll play feather-fun games and explore how every wing and chirp is part of a bigger story.It’s not just a walk – it’s a joyful adventure into the wild side of your own neighborhood. Where chirps become clues and wings tell stories!

name: ECHOES OF OLD BANGALORE by Green Panther Club
description: What if the steps you walked on could whisper stories from 200 years ago? On Echoes of Bengaluru, families will discover the Great Trigonometrical Survey (GTS) point tucked into Trinity Church, wander through the Cantonment’s old-world charm, meet a tailor whose family stitched for British officers, and pause by the serene Halasuru Tank to hear tales of visionaries like Rao Bahadur Mudaliar.It’s history told as adventure – a trail of secrets, sights, and stories that bring old Bangalore alive for kids and parents alike. Walking through stories, not just streets!

name: WINGS & WONDERS WALK by Green Panther Club
description: Step into the golden glow of dusk by Halasuru Lake – where wings take flight, birdsong fills the air, and little explorers discover nature’s evening magic.When the sun begins to set, the lake comes alive! On Wings & Wonders Walk, kids and parents will stroll along Halasuru Lake, spotting flocks returning home, listening to evening bird calls, and learning fun ways to track our feathered friends. Along the way, we’ll play bird-themed games, capture observations in nature journals, and soak in the calm that dusk brings.It’s a gentle walk woven with wonder – a chance for families to slow down together, connect with the wild, and end the day with a touch of magic. Where every flap of wings tells an evening story!

name: Time Travel Bangalore by Green Panther Club
description: Step into a 1000-year-old temple, stroll by a timeless tank, and uncover the living legends tucked into Halasuru’s heart. 🛕🌊Evenings are made for a little magic, and Time Travel Bengaluru brings just that! Starting at the 1000-year-old Someshwara Temple, families will step into Chola-era stories carved in stone. We’ll wander through Halasuru’s streets, pause by its tank to hear echoes of Shivajinagar, and, if time permits, step into a tailor’s shop that still carries whispers of the Cantonment days.This 2 km stroll is more than a walk – it’s an adventure through time, where every turn holds a story waiting to be discovered by kids and parents alike. An evening where the past walks beside you!

name: The Magical Kingdom by Lunasole (For Ages 4-7)
description: Hear ye, young adventurers!Step into a land of castles, crowns, and mythical beasts where cardboard becomes the key to your very own fairy-tale world. Spark creativity by transforming everyday items - cardboard boxes, tubes, bottle caps, and fabric scraps into fantastic creations.What will you do?🎨 Paint a giant castle together, bringing its towers and walls to life with colour and imagination.👑 Build fairy crowns and swords fit for royalty.🎭 Transform yourself into a knight, fairy, or wizard - and let your imagination rule the kingdom!Through open-ended play, children will repurpose everyday discarded items like boxes, tubes, bottle caps, and fabric scraps, into imaginative creations of their own design. This workshop sparks creativity, problem-solving, and collaboration, while nurturing an early awareness of sustainability by demonstrating how ordinary recyclables can be transformed into extraordinary possibilities.

name: Coffee and Conversations
description: What about some Filter Coffee and Unfiltered conversations on a fine Sunday morning?Listeners Circle is an initiative to facilitate listening without judgment, hence giving a safe space for anyone to speak their heart out without the fear of judgment.We at Listeners Circle are committed to building a community where there are no unsaid words, held back emotions and buried feelings because of the fear of being judged.After 50+ Editions of Tell your Story, Listeners Circle relaunching a lighter format - Coffee and Conversations!Coffee lightens us up. Coffee gives us clarity. Coffee refreshes up. Sip a coffee and speak your heart out without fear of judgment and listen without judging! Coffee is on us and the onus of conversation without judgment is on you.Every word matters. Every emotion matters. Every feeling matters.Think about how it would feel to take an hour out of your fast-paced life and share your experiences and thoughts to people who listen to you without judging over a cup of Coffee? Also, listen to others without judging.Listeners` circle Coffee and Conversations -This is an event to make that happen.Speak your mind without being judged. Speak your mind without any boundaries. No photography and videography without consent. Your stories stay within the four walls of the room and the hearts.Would you like to just listen? We have a place for you too.Book your passes in advance to avoid the last-minute sell outs.Listeners Circle is an initiative to facilitate listening without judgment, hence giving a safe space for anyone to speak their heart out without the fear of judgment. We have done 50+ sessions over the last year, enabling people to voice their stories. Coffee & Conversations is our new format based on popular demand.

name: Soumik Datta | Travellers
description: Soumik Datta | Travellers Award-winning sarod musician and composer Soumik Datta blends ambient soundscapes, spoken word, and Indian classical roots to create an experience that is both emotive and immersive. With the evocative voice of the sarod at its heart, Travellers is a sonic journey that layers field recordings and immersive sound design with live music that stretches time and pulses between memories, transporting audiences across the invisible borders that divide land, places, and people. This performance is part of Soumik’s Melodies in Slow Motion Tour, a seven-month journey across India that brings his music to concert halls, homes, heritage sites, juvenile centres, national borders, and schools, interacting with marginalised communities that often go unheard. Credits: Sarod & Composition - Soumik Datta Violin - Sayee Rakshith Tabla - Debjit Patitundi Mridangam & Percussion - Sumesh Narayanan “Travellers” is co-produced by Soumik Datta Arts, G5A In Residence & Arts Council England. The show is presented by Culturegrind. Entry only on advance ticket booking. Seating on first come first serve basis. Gates open at 6.45 PM. NO PARKING at the venue. Parking only at Westside or Dickenson Road.

name: Qu for Quiz
description: The Qu for Quiz is based on a grid format with the grids formed by topics on one axis and level of difficulty (and hence the points) on the other. The topics could be varied like History, Sports, Music, Literature, Movies and more. A team of two members would get to choose a topic and the level of difficulty and the question would be revealed. The rest of the teams can go for the buzzer if they know the answer. Depending on the number of teams registering, the size of the grid would be decided. SAMPLE Qu: 2. The name is inspired by the traditional malt whisky distillation process in which malted barley was mixed by hand with shovels. This labor-intensive process often caused a shoulder injury to workers, causing their arms to hang low. Which brand is named thus? Teams are comprised of 2 people

name: Vrindaban, Present Please
description: An Interactive play written and performed by Somudranil SarkarAbout the play "Vrindaban, Present Please" is an immersive, one-man interactive play set in a rural Indian village, where Samiran Banerjee, a Kolkata teacher, is transferred to a village school after a Supreme Court ruling. Assigned to a chaotic school once led by the mysteriously absent Salma Khatoon, Samiran's efforts to restore order only lead him deeper into unsettling events. From a water shortage to a snake in his room, his attempts to connect with the eccentric villagers only intensify his isolation. But behind it all, Samiran harbors a secret—someone named Vrindaban. Why does he hide this figure? Is it the only refuge in a world that refuses to understand him? The play unravels questions about isolation, hidden truths, and the blurred lines between personal and professional life.About the artist:  Somudranil Sarkar, a theatre maker from kolkata. He has over 25 years of experience in theatre and has had the privilege of training under some of the most respected names in the Bengali theatre circuit, including Rudraprasad Sengupta, Swatilekha Sengupta, Debshankar Halder, Sohini Sengupta, and Goutam Halder in Nandikar. He has also trained in mime under the guidance of mime guru Jogesh Dutta. Over the years, he has directed and acted in over 100 plays and curated various theatre workshops for diverse groups. Somudranil has received the Azhar Alam Young Director’s Award for his contribution to the field.

This isn’t just doodles and colors, it’s a peek into your child’s world. A world shaped by everyday observations and experiences. This workshop opens up space for open-ended conversations with your child that may reveal cues about their interests, thoughts, and needs.So, join us for an hour filled with colors, conversation, and creativity - and walk away with a storybook that’s uniquely yours.Takeaways from this workshop:- A storybook illustrated and authored by your child- An hour of conversational creativity- Insight into your child’s current interests and needs- Moments of bonding and joy with your child

name: Atta Galatta presents “Support Group”
description: Support Group by Nimesh George and Gokul R. People make up big cities but what makes up people’s lives, hopefully not loneliness. Loneliness is an intensely painful state which arises out of lack of intimacy and connectedness. People from every walk of life, even those with social contacts or pursuing successful careers can experience sadness from absence of belongingness. This painful experience is felt in a myriad of contexts such as breakups, disagreeing families, fear of rejection, unrelatability, shyness and so on.This support group has been constituted to bring people struggling with disconnectedness in various contexts together for a shared experience of comfort, belongingness, laughter, guidance and above all to break the cycle of sustained loneliness.The support is being organized and moderated by Nimesh George Mphil PhD who is a practicing psychologist based in Bangalore. This session will be co-moderated by Nimesh George & Gokul R, who are both practising psychologists in Bangalore.

name: The BWW Book of Emerging Poets
description: Bangalore Writers Workshop presents “The BWW Book of Emerging Poets”Book Launch with Bhumika AnandSun, 05 Oct 2025, 7:00 PM Bangalore Writers Workshop (BWW) showcases 39 emerging global poets with 116 poems in this anthology, The BWW Book of Emerging Poets. This book commemorates ten years of the BWW Poetry workshop with its flower batches inspired by Charles Baudelaire’s Les Fleurs du mal. We can assure you there is a poem for everyone. Read in order or pick a poem a day. Let our poems move you and inspire you. Come, celebrate our poets with us. BWW is the first-of-its-kind writing and storytelling school in Bangalore, India. Founded in 2011, we have since been running intensive and supportive creative writing and other workshops, while building a community of writers in the city. BWW’s mission is to foster the creative mind, encourage a community, and make writers aware of who they are as creators of text. 'Every poet in this anthology is intense and passionate about poetry, while being unique. A delight to read this orchestra of voices. Kudos to the Bangalore Writers Workshop for bringing out the best in all these poets.' - Mani Rao.Come meet poets Lara C Caldwell, Nida Sahar, Parnika Reys Gamat, Philip John, Rahul Krishnan, Ritika Chandy and Sarita Talwai.Join us for the launch of this anthology at Atta Galatta on 5th October at 7 PM!

name: Kirtan with Neha: An Evening of Modern Kirtan Jams
description: A Musical Kirtan Jamming sessionSat, 04 Oct 2025, 5:00PMStep away from the everyday and into a space of pure positive energy. "Kirtan with Neha" is a unique evening presented by Kirtan Intelligence, where ancient chants meet modern rhythm. This is not your typical spiritual gathering—it's a dynamic, interactive experience of music, mindfulness, and community. Join us for a modern Kirtan Jamming session dedicated to fostering wellness and inner peace through soulful vibrations and shared energy. It’s an opportunity to connect with something bigger than yourself, and most importantly, with yourself.Why to joinThis event is a powerful antidote to the pressures of modern life. Whether you are a professional grappling with burnout, a student facing academic stress, or a young person/a mother/a homemaker or anyone, feeling overwhelmed and lacking focus, this evening is for you. We provide a space to combat the feeling of being "stuck" and find a renewed sense of clarity and purpose. By chanting together, you’ll not only find a release from stress but also an inner strength that helps you navigate life's challenges. It's a mindful pause to reset, recharge, and rediscover your inner resilience.FeaturingThe evening is led by Neha Agarwal with a uniquely grounded perspective. With a background as a Chartered Accountant, Company Secretary, and an IIM Lucknow Alumni, Neha has navigated the demanding corporate world with over a decade of experience, including working with Big 4s, startups, and non-profits.  Leading the Kirtan Jamming with the Kirtan Intelligence team, she brings a belief "More of Kirtan = Less of Stress."What to expectPrepare for a holistic experience that engages your mind, body, and soul. * A unique jamming session that blends soulful chants with a mixer of slow and high beats, making you move not just from the outside, but also from within. * Guided meditation interludes to help you anchor your focus and find your calm center. * Food for thought conversations where we connect personal and professional problems with the transformative power of chanting. * Networking with a purpose—connect with a community of like-minded individuals, fostering positive vibrations and meaningful connections. * A complete detox for your mind and body, leaving you feeling refreshed, rejuvenated, and full of positive energy.Ending quoteCome, get and spread the positive energy by chanting together.Your inner harmony is just one chant away.

name: The Wildflower of Assam
description: Join us for an engaging evening at Atta Galatta, Bangalore’s iconic bookstore and cultural space, as Gayatri Sarkar discusses her acclaimed debut novel The Wildflower of Assam.Set against the turbulent backdrop of Assam between the 1950s and 1980s, this historical and women’s fiction novel traces the lives of migrant women navigating displacement, resilience, and identity. Through the unforgettable character of Shabana and her family, the story weaves together themes of survival, migration, and the search for belonging.In conversation with Sweety Roy, Gayatri will share insights into her research, writing journey, and the social realities that shaped the novel. The discussion will be followed by an audience Q&A and a book signing session.Why attend?Discover the inspiration and untold history behind The Wildflower of AssamBe part of an intimate conversation on migration, women’s voices, and resilienceConnect with the author and get your copy signed

description: Ganga’s Curse is a ‘re-telling’ of the Puranic story of Ganga’s descent to Earth by children’s author and storyteller Kapil Pandey. name: Invisible Housemates-Book Signing
description: Beyond and within the familiar confines of our home, a vibrant, bustling ecosystem thrives, often unnoticed, but always present. This book is an exploration of that hidden world, a journey into the lives of the animals, birds and insects that share our dwellings and the spaces immediately surrounding them. Some are beneficial, acting as natural pest control, while others can be perceived as nuisances, challenging our sense of control and cleanliness. Yet, they all contribute to the rich tapestry of life that surrounds us, each with wonderous stories of survival, adaptation, and interaction.This book aims to illuminate these often-overlooked, invisible housemates, to bridge the gap between our human-centric perspective and the fascinating world they occupy. I delve into the natural history of 13 amazing creatures, exploring their behaviours, life cycles, and ecological roles. I examine the intricate relationships they have with each other and with us, the humans who share their space. How do our actions, our habits, and the very architecture of our homes influence their lives? How do they, in turn, impact our own? After reading this book, I hope that readers can develop a more appreciative eye for these marvellous creatures, even the ones that incite fear, gain a richer understanding of the natural world and our place within it.

You can escape into a world of leisure, populated by broad-shouldered noble lords and witty ladies who dreamt of love over a marriage of convenience ...Often set in Regency-era London, these novels revolved around the lives of the wealthy upper classes – society’s ton and their quirks.Whether you are a fan of many years or someone who is just starting out reading her novels you are more than welcome to join us to discuss and marinate in her world...

name: Awakening : Freedom From Suffering
description: Awakening has been the basis of most of the ancient practices and texts, like Yoga or Zen. In Ancient times, It was the most obvious process to aspire for. Somehow in the modern times, it has been either mystified and shown as an extraordinary thing (limited to a few people) or something which is taken as a myth and not real. In this gathering, we will explore "Awakening" from all perspectives. We will unwrap the wrappers of religion and spirituality and go to the core of Awakening.​We will also discuss if there is a path to awakening or is it pathless.​This session will definitely show you a way towards liberation from suffering.​ This is also an AMA with Ashwin about Awakening.​The event joining fee is Rs.. 499 only. Collected mainly to make this event sustainable and self-sufficient.​In case you can’t afford it and still want to join, pls message us and we will give you a scholarship.​About the Guide:​Ashwin writes and speaks about breaking free from the shackles of suffering that arise from our identification with the psychological self. He points to the recognition of our natural state, which is inherently peaceful and joyful, and available to everyone. His own journey has been one of intense suffering and eventual freedom. Along the way, he encountered many great teachers, but more importantly, he undertook numerous silent sabbaticals, deep inquiries, and personal experiments to discover the truth through direct experience.

description: How do we nurture curiosity and wonder in children about the world right outside our door?This month’s Literacy Circle — The Earth Has a Child’s Heart, curated by Bond Over Bindings and The Earthling Early Years, invites you to explore that question with us.Through their books and foundations, Suhel Quader (ATREE) and Pallavi Patil (The Snail Network) will share ways to spark children’s imagination — using tools, resources, activities, journals, and stories that connect them deeply to nature.Together, we’ll also reflect on how conversations about nature and sustainability can grow into everyday lifestyle choices.

name: Pint of View (Lecture 6): Deja Oops
description: Welcome to Pint of View – Bangalore's first-ever community where classroom-styled lectures meet craft cocktails in pubs and bars.In our sixth lecture, we’re bringing you Dr. Sumyuktha Anand, a neuroscientist and science communicator who calls herself a neuroscience nerd. She has explored everything from addiction and reward circuits to the neuroscience of brain tumors, and while she earned her Ph.D. in Molecular and Cellular Biology, what excites her most is stepping outside the lab to share just how fascinating our brains really are. Passionate about making science accessible, Sumyuktha brings the marvels of neuroscience to non-specialist communities and now, to you — over a pint.Her talk, Déjà Oops: Why Neuroscience Says Your Memory Can’t Be Trusted, dives into the quirks of memory and the science of neuroplasticity. We like to think of memory as a reliable archive, but the truth is it’s constantly being rewritten, distorted, and reinvented by our brains. Why does this happen? What does it say about how our brains work? And how does this “unreliability” help us more than it harms us?Come find out, and bring your questions — from everyday forgetfulness to the bigger mysteries of how memory shapes identity.All of this, over Geist beer on tap at Jamming Goat 3.0, Indiranagar! 🍻What to Expect:A 60-minute lecture on memory, neuroplasticity, and why our brains misremember15–20 minutes of interactive Q&AOne Geist beer on tap or a mocktail included with your ticketA lively mixer to share your insights, laugh over your “oops” moments, and walk away seeing your memory in a whole new wayEvent Details:📅 Sunday, 5th October | 4 PM – 6 PM📍 Jamming Goat 3.0, Indiranagar🎫 Limited to 60 attendees only💰 Early bird pricing available for the first 10 ticketsAbout the LecturerDr. Sumyuktha Anand is a neuroscientist and science communicator who has researched topics ranging from addiction and reward circuits to brain tumors. With a Ph.D. in Molecular and Cellular Biology, she is passionate about making brain science fun and accessible beyond academic circles — through teaching, writing, and now, with Pint of View.About Pint of ViewInspired by the successful Lectures on Tap community in the U.S., Pint of View brings this format to India for the first time. It’s where big ideas meet bar tables, and where you enjoy a drink in hand while walking out with a new way of seeing the world.Book now & develop your own pint of view! 🍻
